result.execSummary:
The defendant Lukas Donald Benish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:22 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lukas Donald Benish in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Lukas Donald Benish.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard on sentence. Defendant will plead no contest.  Atty Erickson approaches bench with plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Recommends a $300.00 fine plus costs. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews min/max penalties. Defendant states understanding. Court asks defendants plea. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea.   Court finds the defendant guilty of DC. 

State is heard on sentence. Recommends a $300.00 fine plus court costs. 
Atty Erickson is heard on sentence. Requests a lowered financial penalty. 7 days credit. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $200.00 fine plus court costs. 7 days credit. Bond to be applied. Total of $705.00.  $555.00 balance after bond is applied. PP $30.00 per month. Commencing July 1st, 2022.  1st of each month thereafter. PPF $15.00

2:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lukas Donald Benish appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Lukas Donald Benish.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. Erickson requests a plea/sentencing date.
     Court concludes at 2:35 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Lukas Donald Benish.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Defendant stands mute, clerk to enter a not guilty plea into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:04 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lukas Donald Benish in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Brittany Pagel pd. $150 to CCSO on 3/28/22

1:18 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lukas D Benish appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA Requests $150.00 cash bond. No abusive or violent contact with BP.

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. No abusive or violent contact with BP.

Court advises the right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No abusive or violent contact with B.P.
